documents.title: leadsom defends pm 's fire response
text: the leader of the house of commons , andrea leadsom , has told me the prime minister has been `` totally affected '' by the grenfell tower disaster .
as we mentioned earlier , the south northamptonshire mp visited the site this morning and received an angry response from some residents .
the prime minister visited survivors in hospital today , but had faced criticism for not meeting residents at the scene of the blaze yesterday .
andrea leadsom told me theresa may has been `` totally affected '' by the fire and had `` absolutely prioritised making sure that we are doing everything we possibly can to help '' .
the mp described the reception she had from local people as `` mixed '' and said `` quite understandably some people are angry '' .
she said it was `` truly heartbreaking to see what has happened '' and mps were `` absolutely resolved '' to `` support people in the short term and the long term '' .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: rushden lakes : councillor says towns must 'work with the future ' as development prepares to open
text: a local councillor says northampton town centre needs to `` work with the future '' as a major new retail park prepares to open in the county next month .
the rushden lakes development was strongly opposed by councils in northampton , kettering and corby .
they claimed the retail park could damage existing town centres already suffering from a number of empty shop units .
but in july the first shops - including marks and spencer , house of fraser and next - will open .
`` it 's right that we did campaign against rushden lakes , '' tim hadland , the councillor for regeneration in northampton , told the bbc .
`` it 's government policy to encourage town centres , ironically , and then the government gave permission for rushden lakes .
but that is now history and we 've got to work with the future .
`` the nature of towns and town centres is changing .
who would have thought 20 years ago that we could drink so much coffee , or eat so many meals ? ''
earlier this week it was confirmed that skate and ski company two seasons will close its two northampton stores , with the chain re-locating to rushden lakes instead .

documents.title: ben walker : funeral of teenage footballer to take place
text: the funeral of a thrapston teenager who died after collapsing during a football match takes place today .
ben walker , who attended prince william school in oundle , collapsed while playing for thrapston town juniors on 28 april .
he was an aspiring footballer and keen supporter of aston villa .
villa supporters held a minute 's applause in his memory at their match against brighton last month .
`` people will remember him , '' nick price from thrapston town , told bbc radio northampton .
`` because he was so young , he had n't really started his life .
it [ the funeral ] is remembering the short life he had , but what he did in that short life and how he touched so many people in that time . ''
a fundraising page set up to raise money for a memorial to ben and to support his family has now raised more than £ 24,000 .
`` he had a great sense of humour , '' added steve harvey , head of school at prince william school .
`` he was a peacemaker and somebody that was always out and about making sure people were happy and jolly around the school . ''
the boy 's family have asked those attending the funeral to wear sport-related tops in his honour .

documents.title: suspect in moped hit-and-run released under investigation
text: a man , who was arrested in connection with a moped crash which seriously injured a three-year-old boy in northampton , has been released on police bail .
the child , who has not been named , was playing in a grassy area of derwent drive when he was hit by a moped which had left the road at about 16:25 on monday .
the boy was taken to northampton general hospital , where he was treated for serious head and facial injuries .
the moped rider , who was not wearing a helmet , reportedly failed to stop at the scene , but on tuesday police confirmed that they had arrested a man in connection with the incident .

documents.title: new attractions for irchester country park thanks to grant
text: visitors to irchester country park can now experience the history of ironstone quarrying in the area .
it 's part of a new heritage project highlighting geological finds that date back millions of years .
the £ 120,000 initiative has been paid for by the heritage lottery fund .
`` i am delighted with the wonderful range of new features we are able to offer at irchester country park as a result of the heritage lottery fund grant . ''
said chris haines , the countryside services manager for northamptonshire county council .

`` lots of people have been involved in the project and thousands of visitors will learn about the park 's heritage and enjoy the variety of activities available through this project for years to come . ''
the new attractions include a viewing platform , which is shaped like one of the old dragline diggers , showing the history of ironstone quarrying in the area in the 1920s and 30s .
`` the council 's parks attract two million visitors a year collectively , '' added sylvia hughes , the cabinet member for public health and wellbeing in northamptonshire .

`` this new project will provide visitors with historical insight , educational features and interactive opportunities for young and old across the county to enjoy , in addition to supporting the long term sustainability of the park '' .
author: Carroll Weston
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: cobblers midfielder beautyman joins stevenage
text: northampton town midfielder harry beautyman has joined league two side stevenage on a free transfer .
beautyman , 25 , joined the cobblers from peterborough united last summer and made 13 starts and 11 substitute appearances at sixfields .
however , he was transfer listed at the end of the 2016-17 campaign .
`` i know harry was looking to play first team football and this is a good move for him , '' northampton manager justin edinburgh told the club 's website .
`` he did n't play as much here as he would have liked last season , so we spoke at the end of the season .
`` we were honest in saying he may have found that his opportunities remained limited here moving forwards and so we made him available for transfer .
`` this move works for all parties .
he goes with our best wishes , his attitude here was first class and we wish him every success with his new club . ''

documents.title: moldovan police officers visit northamptonshire
text: a group of police officers from moldova is visiting northamptonshire police this week .

the visit , which has been organised by human rights organisation the soros foundation - moldova is designed to help the moldovan officers learn about the police and criminal evidence act ( pace ) and what it means for british policing .
`` the police and criminal evidence act is well regarded across the world as including best practice for the police , '' said northamptonshire 's chief constable simon edens .

moldova is a relatively young country where the government is in the process of reforming the police , and we hope we have been able to fairly demonstrate the work that forces across the uk do during the group 's visit . ''
the group are also learning how the force use standard operating procedures such as stop and search , use of force and how police custody areas are managed .

the visitors from moldova , which emerged as an independent republic following the collapse of the soviet union in 1991 , include the deputy chief of the general police inspectorate , the deputy chief of cid and a defence attorney .

documents.title: new northampton south mp says it 's 'very different ' to past public office experience
text: the newly elected mp for northampton south , andrew lewer , has told bbc radio northampton that he 's excited by the prospect of representing his new constituency at parliament .
mr lewer was voted in with a majority of 1,159 ( 2,634 votes down on outgoing conservative mp david mackintosh )
he has previously served as the leader of derbyshire county council , and more recently as an mep for the east midlands .
`` it 's very different , '' he said .
`` it 's a sort of a combination in a way of my time as a county council leader , and as an mep .
`` the council was purely executive ; the european parliament was purely legislative .
the westminster parliament is actually a bit of both . ''
earlier this week , mr lewer attended a meeting of the party 's backbench 1922 committee , where prime minister theresa may was pressed for more details on talks with the dup .
the committee is made up of all conservative backbenchers - the name is taken from the year in which its original members were elected .

mr lewer added that the meeting was `` more lively and raucous '' than such meetings are in brussels , but added that `` the prime minister got a very warm welcome and set out quite firmly her intention to govern '' .

documents.title: tim farron quits : local lib dem says 'philosophical issues ' troubled outgoing leader
text: the liberal democrat candidate for northampton south at the general election says outgoing party leader tim farron `` knew when he ought to resign '' .

mr farron , who had led the lib dems since july 2015 , resigned from his position yesterday citing that he became `` torn '' between his christian faith and his duties as leader of a political party .

`` it 's very difficult for him as a committed christian to deal with some of the philosophical issues that come up in elections , '' said jill hope , who polled 3.4 % of the votes in the seat won by andrew lewer of the conservatives .
`` but remember that tim farron did vote in favour of gay marriage .
it 's a difficult issue and he 's wrestled with it for many years . ''
in a statement last night , mr farron said he should have dealt `` more wisely '' with questions relating to his faith during the election campaign , including his views on gay sex .
church leaders praised mr farron .
the archbishop of canterbury justin welby said he was `` honourable and decent '' .
`` give tim his due , '' hope added .
`` as a party leader he made a decision and he knew when he ought to resign .
`` i wish some of the other party leaders would come to the same conclusion . ''
possible successors for the leadership include former ministers sir vince cable , jo swinson , sir ed davey and norman lamb .

documents.title: beloved station cat passes away
text: tributes have been paid to a beloved member of the rushden transport museum and railway - alfie , the station cat .
he passed away just a few days ago after contracting a unidentified virus .
the feline mysteriously turned up at volunteer-run rushden station about 10 years ago just after the previous station cat passed away , and quickly made it his home .
when he became unwell last week a justgiving page was set-up for alfie to pay his vet bills , and more than £ 850 was raised .
the much-loved ginger tom had his own facebook page with thousands of followers from all over the world .
in a post written to communicate alfie 's death , the author of the page wrote that vet bills had been covered by the donations .
he said the remaining funds and money hoped to be made at a fundraiser on saturday would go towards a memorial `` in a prominent place '' at the station .
hundreds of people have since written tributes to the cat .
one wrote : `` so very sorry to hear of alfie 's passing .
he knew how much he was loved , by you , his humans and by everyone he met at the station and his fans ! ''
another added : `` i have so enjoyed in the last couple of years seeing about all of his doings at the station and how treasured a member of the community he was . ''

documents.title: theatre producers to hold dog auditions for forthcoming musical
text: producers of a new tour of the broadway and west end show legally blonde the musical are trying to find a bulldog to appear in the show when it comes to northampton 's royal and derngate in october .

based on the 2001 reese witherspoon film of the same name , the musical tells the story of elle woods - a fashionable college student who takes up law school in response to a break-up with her boyfriend .
eastenders ' rita simons , eurovision song contest singer lucie jones and bill ward from coronation street and emmerdale are the human stars of the show .
however , it also has two dogs in the cast - a chihuahua called bruiser and another called rufus .
bruiser is already cast and will be on the road with the company , but producers have decided to hold auditions for rufus in every town and city on the tour .
`` we are looking for a big , brutish dog that only its mother could love , '' said associate director david barrett .
`` preferably a bulldog as in the film , but we are certainly open to options . ''
auditions will be held at the royal and derngate on saturday , 15 july .

documents.title: britain - share your personal bests ! london 2017
text: this summer , london is hosting the biggest global sporting events of the year - the 2017 world athletics and para athletics championships - and the organisers have launched a scheme to get people involved in athletics right around the country .
it 's called team personal best and the idea is that local sports clubs or community groups across the uk sign up and put on events with an athletics theme .
it does n't have to be a track-and-field meet - it can be a fun run , family sports day , even an event screening or bake sale with activities .
there 's a list of suggestions on the teampb submission page , here .
event participants are then encouraged to share their athletic achievements - no matter how big or small - with the hashtag # teampersonalbest to build a nationwide buzz around the championships .
you can find events near you here and if you want more information about how to get started in athletics , check out our get inspired guide .

documents.title: east midlands ukip mep helmer to retire
text: roger helmer , one of ukip 's two east midlands meps in the european parliament , is to retire at the end of next month .

he says he expects to be replaced by the next candidate on ukip 's 2014 east midlands candidate list , jonathan bullock , who stood as a candidate in northampton north at last week 's general election .

mr helmer was first elected as a conservative member of the european parliament in 1999 , but defected to ukip five years ago as he felt the conservatives failed to share his views on the role of britain in the eu .
as a well-known climate change sceptic , he says he welcomes donald trump 's withdrawal from the paris climate treaty .
but he says the main point of his political career has been to see the united kingdom vote to leave the eu .
mr helmer says his decision to retire was taken just after the referendum on brexit a year ago and was entirely unconnected with the result of the general election .
author: Willy Gilder
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: still no new provider to take over academy trust 's schools
text: more than three months after an academy trust in northamptonshire asked to hand all its schools back to the government , no new provider has been appointed to run them .
that 's despite the education fellowship trust - or teft - being rated the worst primary school provider in the entire country , in a report issued by the education policy institute in july 2016 .
teft runs 12 schools - nine of them in northamptonshire .
seven are primary schools , two are secondaries , and of the nine , five are rated `` inadequate '' by ofsted :
however , the most recent ofsted update regarding wrenn published two days ago said the school 's leadership was working well to make improvements .
the trust said it was a `` fantastic achievement '' , but declined to comment further on teft 's future .
teft began taking on schools in 2012 .

by 2014 there were concerns over its finances and by last autumn poor educational performances at its schools led to it being served with `` termination warning notices '' , meaning the government would look to stop its funding .
it asked to hand the schools back in march , but it remains in charge while the department for education looks for another trust to take them on .
how long that will take , no-one seems to know .
it leaves the prospect of nine northamptonshire schools starting the next academic year under the control of a trust that wants rid of them .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: nene park : former home of diamonds and poppies razed to the ground
text: in february we told you that bulldozers had started demolishing the former home of rushden and diamonds in northamptonshire .
the club , which began playing football at nene park , irthlingborough , in 1992 , rose through the leagues , reaching the former division two ( now league one ) at its peak in 2003 .
but financial issues led to a rapid demise and the club folded just eight years later .
nene park was then briefly the home of kettering town , but the site has been redundant since 2012 .
the stadium , which had a capacity of 6,400 , was opened by sir bobby robson .
below you can see how the view from diamond way in irthlingborough has changed between 2009 and present day following the completed demolition .
plans that would have seen the ground replaced with a four-storey hotel , cinema , restaurants and a food store failed to materialise following a consultation in 2015 .
it remains unknown what the future of the site will be .
author: Kris Holland
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: charity netball tournament raises £ 1,000 in memory of india chipchase
text: it 's been confirmed a netball tournament involving staff and past and present students of pitsford school has raised £ 1,000 in memory of india chipchase .
the 20-year-old from northampton was murdered in the town last year after being split from her friends on a night out and lured home by a man .
india had been a pupil at the school where she had also been netball captain .
`` india was an avid netballer , '' said lucyann chacksfield , director of sports at the school .
`` she did a lot of coaching for my junior teams , played in local leagues and umpired .
`` we thought it was a fitting tribute to keeping her memory alive within the school environment . ''
the money from the event , which took place on sunday , will go towards the india protocol - a lone female safeguarding project in cheltenham .
under the protocol , volunteers must approach any lone female they encounter after midnight to find out if they need help .

documents.title: success for towcester sisters in women 's tour
text: the women 's tour , which started in northamptonshire last week , came to a climax yesterday .

hannah barnes , from towcester , finished third on the tour overall , as poland 's katarzyna niewiadoma - who won the northamptonshire stage - claimed the overall title following sunday 's race in london .
briton barnes - riding for canyon sram - finished second on the 62km ( 39-mile ) street race to move on to the podium as belgium 's jolien d'hoore won the stage , with christine majerus in third .
luxembourg 's majerus finished second overall , 1:18 minutes behind niewiadoma .
barnes ' sister alice ( drops team ) , also from towcester , was sixth , meaning the siblings finished as the top two british cyclists .
britain 's defending champion lizzie deignan finished 42nd overall , while olympic team pursuit champion katie archibald was 18th .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: government 'in chaos ' , says corby labour candidate
text: meanwhile , the labour candidate for corby in last week 's general election , beth miller , says the government is `` in chaos '' after a hung parliament .
ms miller finished second to conservative candidate tom pursglove in the north northamptonshire constituency , but the tories lost their parliamentary majority in thursday 's snap election .
`` they were expecting a huge landslide , '' she told bbc radio northampton .
`` i think there was a degree of arrogance there . ''
prime minister theresa may says she will try to do a deal with the democratic unionist party ( dup ) - northern ireland 's largest unionist party .
the dup has 10 mps and if they vote with the conservatives , the government will be able to get its business through parliament .
`` what we 've got is a chaotic situation with the tories relying on the dup , despite disagreeing on so many issues , '' ms miller added .
later on monday , mrs may will face tough questions from her backbenchers at a meeting of the 1922 committee .

documents.title: new cabinet role for northamptonshire mp
text: south northamptonshire mp andrea leadsom has been appointed as leader of the house in the commons in a conservative party cabinet reshuffle .

ms leadsom , who contested the conservative leadership against now prime minister theresa may in 2016 , moves from the department for environment , food and rural affairs where she was secretary of state .
her previous role has been filled by former justice secretary michael gove , who mrs may previously removed from her cabinet last july .
ms leadsom , who has been an mp since 2010 , saw her majority in south northamptonshire cut from 26,416 to 22,840 in thursday 's general election .

documents.title: vice chancellor defends waterside campus spend
text: new ways of working at the university of northampton 's under development waterside campus will `` add value for money for students '' .
that is the opinion of the university 's vice chancellor , nick petford , who also denied criticism the £ 350m campus would be `` financial suicide '' .
mr petford was answering critics who said the project , based at nunn mills road , was over-reliant on online teaching , instead of face-to-face contact .

a number of former employees told the bbc the scheme , which is expected to see 15,000 students and 2,000 staff on site , amounted to `` financial suicide '' , calling it a vanity project for mr petford .
but he said the university 's accounts were `` passed with flying colours '' and the project had been ticked off by the higher education funding council for england , auditors and hm treasury .
`` how come the regulator , auditors and the treasury have got it so wrong and one or two ex-members of staff know better , '' he said .
he added some people were `` a bit bitter '' about what was a `` big change project '' , in which `` there are bound to be people who are upset or do n't quite understand '' .
the waterside campus is due to open next september .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: university of northampton 's waterside campus criticised as 'financial suicide '
text: the university of northampton 's new waterside campus has been criticised as `` financial suicide '' and not fit for purpose .
a number of former and current employees , who did not want to be named , have contacted the bbc to express concerns about the project .
the 58-acre ( 23.5-hectare ) campus off nunn mills road , known as `` destination waterside '' , will cost £ 350m - with the university having borrowed the vast majority of that .
the money will not be fully repaid for 40 years and will cost almost £ 10m every year in repayments .

one former employee called the site , which was heralded as `` vital for the future of the university and the town '' when unveiled , `` financial suicide '' , adding : `` with brexit coming and european union numbers uncertain , the university can not be confident about student recruitment numbers . ''
another described the proposals , which include four academic buildings , floodlit sports pitches and a hotel , as `` an expensive venture '' and a `` huge risk '' .
there are also concerns about a lack of lecture halls and private spaces , and a reliance on hot-desking .
the stated aim of the new campus is to increase the focus on seminars and tutorials , including one-to-one or small group discussions .
but two more ex-staff members told the bbc they were worried there would be less opportunities to hear high profile speakers and no private areas for discussions about personal matters .
one said it would `` lack the actual , real-world experience lecturers bring '' .
a spokesman for the university said the development was subject to the `` highest level of scrutiny '' by the treasury and was `` on time and on budget '' .
he added the university was evolving its teaching and environment `` to match how higher education must be delivered in the 21st century '' .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: e-fit released after attempted rape of 14-year-old girl in northampton
text: detectives investigating the attempted rape of a 14-year-old girl have released an e-fit of the suspect .
the appeal follows an attack on ridge walk - an alleyway between middlemead court and hertford close in standens barn , northampton , some time between 16:00 and 16:30 on tuesday , 28 march .
police said the victim was walking along the alley when she was assaulted and pulled to the floor by the suspect .
she then kicked him twice and managed to run away .
officers said the attacker was white , aged in his early 40s and about 5ft 7in tall .
he had a medium build , shaved brown-grey hair and a goatee beard .
he also had a deep voice , a northampton accent , he smelt of alcohol and may have been drunk , police said .
anyone who recognises the description of the suspect has been asked to get in touch .

documents.title: kettering mp hollobone wo n't call for may 's resignation
text: the conservative mp for kettering , philip hollobone , says he wo n't support calls for theresa may to resign as prime minister .
speaking to bbc radio northampton , he said : `` i think she 's done the right thing in being determined to press on and form a government .
the all-important brexit negotiations start in 10 days ' time . ''
however , he added that there had been shortcomings with the party 's campaign .
`` it was all going well until the manifesto was published , '' mr hollobone said .
`` it really had n't been thought through : the social care proposals , the winter fuel allowance proposals , were n't presented properly and there was all sorts of confusion .
`` the election clearly did n't go to plan and we 've got to now work with the sum that we 've got .
she 's doing the right thing by pressing on , putting a new government together and getting brexit off to the best start we can achieve ''
mrs may has said she will put together a government with the support of the democratic unionists ( dup ) that can provide can provide `` certainty '' for the future .
the tories needed 326 seats to win another majority but , with 649 out of the 650 seats declared , they fell short and must rely on the dup to continue to rule .

text: peter bone hot-footed it over from his wellingborough victory - to see young whipper-snapper tom pursglove hold corby .

this has been a very difficult election and whoever forms the next government tomorrow morning is going to have to handle the very big challenges that we face .

whether it 's standing up for our steel industry , whether it 's protecting our villages from unwanted over-development , whether it 's delivering the rushden lakes development - these are all key priorities that we have to see delivered in the weeks , months and years ahead . ''

documents.title: northampton south : 'concerns raised on doorstep ' about former mp david mackintosh

it 's after mr mackintosh was criticised over a loan to northampton town football club from the borough council - when he was leader - to rebuild sixfields stadium and develop nearby land .
about £ 10.25m of that money is now missing and the loan is subject to a police investigation into `` alleged financial irregularities '' .
mr mackintosh has denied any wrongdoing .
here 's a flavour of the night - the count was held under the same roof as northampton north .

documents.title: east analysis : a night that belonged to labour
text: it has been a shocking night for the conservatives in this region while labour celebrated three gains across the east .
the liberal democrats held on to their only seat but ukip failed in their bid to regain clacton .
labour wrestled peterborough , ipswich and bedford from the conservatives and returned thumping majorities in luton north and norwich south , where clive lewis 's majority more than doubled .
labour 's biggest increase was in cambridge , where mp daniel zeichner in cambridge took his majority from about 600 to 12,500 .
the conservatives ' high point was regaining clacton , but elsewhere majorities were reduced across the board and they failed to take north norfolk from the liberal democrats .
despite a concerted campaign by the conservatives to take the seat , norman lamb held on with only a slightly reduced majority .
elsewhere , it was not a good night for the liberal democrats , with both bob russell , in colchester , and julian huppert , in cambridge , failing to regain seats they once held .
ukip 's share of the vote has dropped by 14 % across the region and the liberal democrats stayed stubbornly flat on 7 % .
although the conservatives ' vote share did increase by 6 % , it was overtaken by labour who increased their share by 11 % .
the map of the east remains resolutely blue , but the night definitely belonged to labour .
author: Deborah McGurran
BBC East political editor

documents.title: share of the vote across the county
text: here 's a breakdown of the share of the vote across the county overnight :
conservative 56 % ( +5 % )
labour 36 % ( +10 % )
liberal democrat 4 % ( no change )
greens 2 % ( -2 % )
so all-in-all , despite a conservative victory across the board , labour increased its share .

text: ukip has decided not to field a candidate in north norfolk where liberal democrat norman lamb is defending a majority of 4,043 .
the party is asking the 8,300 people who voted for them last time to `` lend '' their votes to the conservatives in order to unseat mr lamb .

ukip has announced `` non-aggression pacts '' against certain brexit-supporting conservatives like stewart jackson in peterborough and philip hollobone in kettering , but this is thought to be the first time it has decided not to stand in order to unseat an anti-brexit candidate .

documents.title: goodbye
text: that 's it for our live coverage of the first stage of the women 's tour 2017 .
the northamptonshire leg is over but there 's still a long , long way to go for the competitors , starting with another 90 miles ( 144km ) tomorrow from stoke-on-trent .
you can of course scroll back here to see highlights from the day .
thanks for joining us .

documents.title: a great day for northamptonshire 's barnes sisters
text: hannah and alice barnes from towcester put in impressive performances in their home county .
alice came seventh - the best-placed british rider - while hannah ( below ) finished fourteenth .
hannah said she enjoyed competing with her sister : `` i came round the last corner and thought i might get a jersey today .
then she came round and we started laughing .
`` it 's great having her in the race and to catch up as i do n't get to see her very often .
`` it was a good , challenging course today and seeing all the schoolkids out on the side of the road was really great .
`` but it 's a really long tour , so you have to really focus on doing the best you can while keeping something back for the following days . ''
their proud mum , sue barnes , said : `` it 's been great and it 's hard to get over that so many people really want to see them .
`` i do n't think they realise how famous they are among the cycling community . ''

documents.title: rockingham prepares for the tour

documents.title: a big day of international sport in the county
text: this is the fourth women 's tour and the fourth time it 's been in northamptonshire .
ever since the first race began in oundle in 2014 , it 's established itself as a big day of international sport in the county , drawing many of the world 's top women cyclists to the county .
it 's also a chance to show off the delights of northamptonshire to the wider world - the rolling countryside as well as the towns such as kettering and daventry .
and once again , hannah barnes and her sister alice carry hopes of a local northamptonshire winner .

documents.title: women 's tour 2017
text: the women 's tour 2017 , begins this morning in northamptonshire .
stage one of the five-day cycling race is a 91.7-mile ( 148km ) route from daventry high street to sheep street in kettering .
all of the world 's top 15 teams will take part in the event , which is a part of the uci women 's worldtour .
lizzie armitstead ( in yellow ) won the event for the first time last year when the final stage was northampton to kettering .
the 27-year-old briton , riding for the boels dolmans team , finished in the pack to preserve her 11-second lead on south africa 's ashleigh moolman-pasio .

documents.title: what will you deliver post-brexit for watford ?
text: brexit remains a huge issue nationally , but what would watford 's candidates make sure it delivered for the town ?

ian stotesbury ( liberal democrats ) said watford had one of the closest counts in the country at the referendum and as such it was `` ludicrous to say any mp would n't want to listen to everyone on the issue '' .
he said he would advocate for the single market and properly control migration within that system .
conservative richard harrington said it would be important that businesses in watford could export and import as they do now , as easily to berlin as they do to birmingham .

he said businesses would need to be able to bring in foreign labour when there were not enough people in the uk market to fill positions , but added that britain could n't be part of the single market .
alex murray , from the green party , said the most important thing would be that britain does n't lose the rights it has now - such as freedom of movement for workers and environmental protections .
but ukip 's gary ling told people not to vote green `` having listened to that '' .

he said `` one of the things we need to understand is that brexit is a process '' and once controls are returned from europe then regulations restricting business can be removed and new trade agreements made .

labour 's chris ostrowski said having a close relationship with the `` key industries '' in watford would be vital so that if they flag up anything in the brexit process which could damage watford then he , as mp , could raise it .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: auditor : 'not clear ' how council will achieve savings
text: an auditor has said it is `` not clear '' how a re-organisation of northamptonshire county council will achieve millions of pounds in planned savings .
the authority is moving its staff into new organisations as part of a new structure called the `` next generation model '' .

this means many employees will instead be employed by outside agencies , if you like , and not the council , with the authority hoping it can save money and allow staff to have more relevant terms and conditions for their work .
but a report by accountants at kpmg say they were `` unable to find a clear line of sight between the design of the next generation council and the saving ( s ) '' .
auditors also said the tax arrangements for the new organisations have not yet been finalised and there was no dedicated person or team in place to oversee planning and risks .
the conservative-controlled county council sees the new model as an important step to dealing with a world where there is a falling income but rising demand for services .
but opposition parties and unions have questioned whether it will work .
in a statement , the county council says it is `` leading the way in creating a new model '' to `` meet the needs of northamptonshire and deliver the required savings '' .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: women 's tour : mother of local cycling sisters excited for race
text: the mum of northamptonshire cyclists hannah and alice barnes says the whole family ca n't wait for the women 's tour to return to the county .
tomorrow the event gets under way , with stage one of this year 's five-day event beginning in daventry and finishing in kettering ; the fourth time the race has come to northamptonshire .
hannah barnes , 24 , rides for the canyon-sram team , while younger sister alice , 21 , competes for drops .
`` we follow them around each stage , '' sue barnes told bbc radio northampton .
the barnes sisters - who grew up in towcester - got into the sport as youngsters .
family trips to cycle the brampton valley way in northamptonshire , and nearby rutland water , led to the girls joining a club in milton keynes .
`` it 's great fun , '' sue barnes said .
`` we really enjoy the whole atmosphere , all the children along the roads all cheering .
`` for it to be in northamptonshire , it 's great .
a lot of the children know alice and hannah come from here , so they are all cheering for them as they go along the roads . ''
radio northampton will have full coverage of wednesday 's daventry to kettering stage , with the 147.5km-long ( 92-mile ) race set to start at 11:00 .
author: Caroline Densley
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: northants ' captain wakely 'could n't watch ' closing stages of durham win
text: northamptonshire 's cricketers defied the weather to beat durham in an extraordinary finish at chester-le-street yesterday .
rain meant they did n't start until 15:00 , with the county needing to chase down 205 to win .
in the end it came down to needing 100 off 17 overs and they made it with just two wickets and one ball to spare .
`` i did n't watch the last two overs , i hid behind , '' said captain alex wakely , who struck 84 runs off 95 balls .
`` rips [ david ripley , head coach ] had to tell me what was going on ; i 'm not very good in those situations .
`` i want to try and get us to win games of cricket , there 's no point playing for draws and to do that you 've got to be prepared to lose .
`` we were going to go all guns blazing there to the end regardless of what the weather was , and fortunately we managed to get a period [ of play ] in . ''
the result lifts northants to fourth in division two of the county championship , with their next match in the competition , against derbyshire at wantage road , to get under way on friday , 9 june .
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: women 's tour : police in northamptonshire review security plans
text: northamptonshire police say that they have reviewed their plans for the women 's tour cycling event , which starts in the county tomorrow .
it follows recent terror attacks in both manchester and london .

the women 's tour - which is a five-stage road cycling event - begins in daventry on wednesday , with the first stage taking in a 147.5km ( about 92 miles ) route around northamptonshire , before finishing in kettering .
`` in the current climate , obviously people are concerned for their safety . ''
supt chris hillery told bbc radio northampton .

`` we want to reassure those [ people ] , so effectively what we 'll be doing is [ providing ] lots of high visibility policing , yellow jackets , police officers on patrol , reassuring people and obviously being vigilant .

`` throughout the planning process we review the national threat level and the threat to various events to make sure our policing and security operation with the event organisers is absolutely up to scratch . ''
it 's the fourth year that the cycling event has been held in northamptonshire .

documents.title: 'new measures needed to keep people safe ' , says counter-terrorism expert
text: meanwhile , a counter-terrorism adviser from wellingborough says saturday 's terror attack in london suggests new measures are needed to keep people safe in built-up areas .
seven died and 48 were injured when a van drove into pedestrians on london bridge and three men stabbed people in borough market .
the so-called islamic state group claimed responsibility for the attack .

describing the nightlife in borough market , simon trundle told bbc radio northampton : `` to see people making a lot of noise and running down the street , it could either be laughing or they could be screaming ; so people did n't respond . ''

the incident was the third terror attack in the uk in three months , following the car and knife attack on westminster bridge in march , in which five people were killed , and the manchester bombing less than two weeks ago in which 22 people died .

mr trundle said in light of the latest attack it should be considered whether bars and restaurants in a confined area are equipped with panic alarms , `` so when one presses it , everybody gets the alarm and they know it means you need to bring people in , lock your premises and you protect your customers '' .
you can read more here on the challenge for security services .

documents.title: teen caught up in manchester terror attack calls benefit gig 'amazing '
text: a northamptonshire teenager who returned to manchester for last night 's one love concert just days after being caught up in the arena terror attack said she could `` feel the love '' at the benefit gig .
brook page , 17 , from milton malsor , was at the manchester arena during last month 's suicide attack at an ariana grande show , which left 22 people dead and dozens injured .
speaking after last night 's gig , she told bbc radio northampton : `` it was amazing .
you could definitely feel the love in the room . ''
grande was joined by an all-star cast on her return to the city , with the likes of coldplay , liam gallagher , take that , katy perry and justin bieber also performing .
asked if the events in the city had put her off going to future gigs , she said : `` no .
it was a lot of love and a lot of support .
`` we went through loads of security , there were lots and lots of people there .
they had little metal detectors that they scanned over you .
you were in very quickly , though .
`` i spoke to a few people around me , but i did n't ask if they were at the concert last month .
we were just talking about who we were excited to see and trying to guess who would be coming on next . ''
